issue.title: Explain why a module hasn't been found in any registry

labels.name: team-ExternalDeps
labels.description: External dependency handling, remote repositiories, WORKSPACE file.

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
This makes it easier for users to discover that a module hasn't been found because its absence was recorded in the lockfile during a previous build.

Fixes #24803

body:
A fix for this issue has been included in [Bazel 7.5.0 RC2](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/releases/tag/7.5.0rc2). Please test out the release candidate and report any issues as soon as possible.
If you're using Bazelisk, you can point to the latest RC by setting USE_BAZEL_VERSION=7.5.0rc2. Thanks!

A fix for this issue has been included in [Bazel 8.1.0 RC1](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/releases/tag/8.1.0rc1). Please test out the release candidate and report any issues as soon as possible.
If you're using Bazelisk, you can point to the latest RC by setting USE_BAZEL_VERSION=8.1.0rc1. Thanks!
